g.title:
<
with the queen 11. Qxc3
mainline11. .. Nd7 12. Bg3
Rc8 13. Kb1 Re8 14. Qd2 with
the idea of exchange the light
squared bishop on e2 14. ..
Bxe2 15. Bxe2 c4 and good
attacking opportunities on the
queen side for black
>
g.text: the idea of exchange the light

g.title:
<
alternatives to 12. Bg3
12. Bd6 to pin the knight,
and attack the c5 pawn. Black
can unpin the knight with Re8
or Bc8 if c5 is lost files
open up for black to attack
the white king.

12. Kb1 Bb7 to attack the e
pawn
>
g.text: and attack the c5 pawn. Black
can unpin the knight with Re8
or Bc8 if c5 is lost files
open up for black to attack

alternatives to 12. Bg3
12. Bd6 to pin the knight,
and attack the c5 pawn. Black
can unpin the knight with Re8
or Bc8 if c5 is lost files
open up for black to attack

12. Kb1 Bb7 to attack the e
pawn

<
The fantasy variation
moves1. e4 c6 2. d4 d5 3. f3
continues with3. .. e6 4.
Nc3 Bb4 provokes white/
PGN file:fantasy variation
>

<

continues with3. .. e6 4.
Nc3 Bb4 provokes white/

>-><
White options after 4. .. Bb4
>

<
5. Ne2
moves 5. .. Ne7 6. a3 Ba5 7.
Be3 Nd7 8. Ng3 0-0 with the
idea of breaking in the center

>
g.text: idea of breaking in the center

g.title:
<
White options after 4. .. Bb4
>-><
5. Ne2
moves 5. .. Ne7 6. a3 Ba5 7.
Be3 Nd7 8. Ng3 0-0 with the
idea of breaking in the center

>

<
5. Bd3 a mistake
looses d4 pawn after exchange
on e4 or after c5 Ne2 looses
the bishop
>
g.text: on e4 or after c5 Ne2 looses

g.title:
<
White options after 4. .. Bb4
>-><
5. Bd3 a mistake
looses d4 pawn after exchange
on e4 or after c5 Ne2 looses
the bishop
>

<
5. Bf4
mainline with idea of Qd3 and
queenside castle5. .. Ne7 6.
Qd3 b6 with the idea to
develop the light squared
bishop to a67. Ne2 to intercept attack
and exchange on Bf1 so black
resolves the light squared
bishop problem.7. .. Ba6 8. Qe3
good position for black where
Nb8 can be easily developed,
ligth squared bishop is
active.8. .. 0-0 9. 0-0-0 c5 to
attack in the center as white
king side attack is coming.10. a3
Bxc3 What does white
recapture with?
>
g.text: mainline with idea of Qd3 and
and exchange on Bf1 so black
attack in the center as white

g.title:
<

with the queen 11. Qxc3
mainline11. .. Nd7 12. Bg3
Rc8 13. Kb1 Re8 14. Qd2 with

Bxe2 15. Bxe2 c4 and good

<
with the knight 11. Nxc3
After11. .. Bxf1 13. Rxf1 c5
pawn could be defended but
13. .. Nc6 14. dxc5 d4 Can't
take the knight but can
capture c515. Qe2 bxc5 16. Na4 Ng6 17.
Bg3 Rc8 . white can't capture
on c5 becuase of Qg5+ wins the
knight. Balanced position with
good attacking opportunities
for black.
>
g.text: on c5 becuase of Qg5+ wins the

g.title:
<
5. Bf4
mainline with idea of Qd3 and
queenside castle5. .. Ne7 6.
Qd3 b6 with the idea to
develop the light squared
bishop to a67. Ne2 to intercept attack
and exchange on Bf1 so black
resolves the light squared
bishop problem.7. .. Ba6 8. Qe3
good position for black where
Nb8 can be easily developed,
ligth squared bishop is
active.8. .. 0-0 9. 0-0-0 c5 to
attack in the center as white
king side attack is coming.10. a3
Bxc3 What does white
recapture with?
>-><
with the knight 11. Nxc3
After11. .. Bxf1 13. Rxf1 c5
pawn could be defended but
13. .. Nc6 14. dxc5 d4 Can't
take the knight but can
capture c515. Qe2 bxc5 16. Na4 Ng6 17.
Bg3 Rc8 . white can't capture
on c5 becuase of Qg5+ wins the
knight. Balanced position with
good attacking opportunities
for black.
>
